result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:42 AM Defendant Richard Dale Hauser not in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Richard Dale Hauser.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:04 PM Defendant Richard Dale Hauser in court, in custody with Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin.
State complied with Victim Witness Notification. WOPH. PQW filed and reviewed. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Not Guilty plea entered.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Issuing Agency: Brodhead PD 
Violations: OWI 4th 
Conditions: May not possess or consume any intoxicants. May not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license on a public highway or roadway in the State of Wisconsin. Defendant shall complete processing at the Brodhead Police Department within 24 hours of his release.

1:15 PM Defendant Richard Dale Hauser appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Lantta appears on behalf of DA Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Jane Krueger Smith appears on behalf of the Defendant for bond purposes only. Defendant given complaint. Court advises defendant of rights. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Court sets bond with conditions. $2,000.00 signature bond.
